Description: Limestone false-door of Nyankhra: this slab preserves the lower part of the right-hand side of a false door with three lines of text containing the name and titles of Nyankhra and the greater part of an offering-list with a small figure of the deceased below. The texts are in carefully carved incised hieroglyphs with much fine detail in the larger signs. The whole surface is a brownish-purply colour which may be a patina but which equally may be the remains of the colour painted on the stela to give it the appearance of granite.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: F A F Mariette
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' III (Oxford: Clarendon Press), 170; Part 2, 586.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.26)
